item.title: Is there a way i can check my player rights level from in game?
item.dc:creator: @X_Kalzachi_X X Kalzachi X
item.description:
@X_Kalzachi_X wrote:

When you log in it will say "Welcome back Administrator/Moderator(your username)"thats if your an Admin Mod or hidden Admin,and if it doesn’t say either of the 2 then your a regular player

heres a simple way: type Hi if u see gold crown your admin if u see silver your mod and if u see ntohing ur nothing

But hidden admins don’t have crowns either XD

item.title: Is there a way i can check my player rights level from in game?
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“Coldbloodio, post:7, topic:127665”]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("checkrights")){ String name = command.substring(12); client is = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; java.lang.String pr = is.playerRights.toString(); sendMessage(""+name+"'s playerright is "+pr+""); }

^ what i got right now

[code]client.java:11109: int cannot be dereferenced
java.lang.String pr = is.playerRights.toString();
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

any ideas?[/quote]

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("checkrights")){ String name = command.substring(12); client is = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; java.lang.String pr = Integer.toString(is.playerRights); sendMessage(""+name+"'s playerright is "+pr+""); }

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way i can check my player rights level from in game?

item.title: Is there a way i can check my player rights level from in game?
item.dc:creator: @Coldbloodio Coldbloodio
item.description:
@Coldbloodio wrote:

if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("checkrights")){ String name = command.substring(12); client is = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; java.lang.String pr = is.playerRights.toString(); sendMessage(""+name+"'s playerright is "+pr+""); }

^ what i got right now

[code]client.java:11109: int cannot be dereferenced
java.lang.String pr = is.playerRights.toString();
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

any ideas?

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way i can check my player rights level from in game?

item.title: Is there a way i can check my player rights level from in game?
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

[quote=“Inmate™, post:2, topic:127665”]if(command.equalsIgnoreCase("checkrights")){ String name = command.substring(12); client is = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; String pr = is.playerRights; sendMessage(""+name+"'s playerright is "+pr+"); }

Something like this …[/quote]

That will not work.
There will be no substring if the text has to equal checkrights with no exceptions.
Use the startsWith() method.
Plus, you’re sendMessage() method’s String is unclosed.
Also String pr cannot be directly an integer, you must do:

java.lang.String pr = is.playerRights.toString();

Read full topic
item.source: Is there a way i can check my player rights level from in game?

item.title: Is there a way i can check my player rights level from in game?
item.dc:creator: @Coldbloodio Coldbloodio
item.description:
@Coldbloodio wrote:

[code]client.java:11080: incompatible types
found : int
required: java.lang.String
String pr = is.playerRights;
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
1 error

Press any key to continue . . .[/code]

Read full topic
